body.p:
New Port Ky
Jan 30. 1864
Gov. Bramlette
Frankfort
My Dear Sir
My son Patrick White is now confined in the penitentiary having sent from the Campbell Cir. Co. in February 1862 for an alleged rape upon one Elizabeth Franklin.

A petition signed by all the jurors who were living at the time it was obtained & statement, showing conclusively that the boy was convicted by ^the^ perjury of the girl and asking for his release were sent up during the adminsitration of Gov. Robinson but I think the Governor never acted upon these in addition to this I can now
obtain a petition by Wm E Arthir Esq who prosecuted the case: The object of this letter is to know whether your Excellency will under the usages of your department give the case a consideration or whether you consider yourself concluded by his action already had by Gov. R. - When at Frankfort the other day I noticed that the petition & statements refered to were not on file and I am induced to believe that Gov. R. has never had the case in any proper manner before him

Campbell Cir Ct
vs
Patrick White
